Create policy

Create an authorisation policy with a list of authorisation rules.

Request Body schema: application/vnd.api+json
required
object

Responses

https://{defaultHost}/api/authorisation_policies

Request samples

  • Payload
Content type
application/vnd.api+json
Example
{
  • "data": {
    • "attributes": {
      • "name": "john",
      • "description": "In non sit quaerat.",
      • "authorisation_rules": [
        • {
          • "path": "/projects/opc/assets/prj_soa",
          • "readable": false,
          • "updatable": false,
          • "executable": false
          },
        • {
          • "path": "/projects/opc/environments/dev",
          • "readable": false,
          • "updatable": false,
          • "executable": false
          }
        ]
      }
    }
}

Response samples

  • 201
  • 400
Content type
application/vnd.api+json
{
  • "data": {
    • "id": "30a00ca1-861c-4c48-8f67-c4a8fe2ad685",
    • "type": "authorisation_policy",
    • "attributes": {
      • "name": "peter.dubuque",
      • "description": "Enim dolorem nulla et.",
      • "system": false,
      • "created_by": "karina",
      • "created_at": "2025-09-11T00:45:23.151261Z",
      • "updated_at": "2025-09-11T00:45:23.151261Z"
      },
    • "relationships": {
      • "policy_rules": {
        • "data": [ ]
        },
      • "policy_assignments": {
        • "data": [ ]
        },
      • "authorisation_rules": {
        • "data": [ ]
        }
      },
    • "links": {
      • "self": "/api/authorisation_policies/30a00ca1-861c-4c48-8f67-c4a8fe2ad685",
      • "policy_rules": "/api/authorisation_policies/30a00ca1-861c-4c48-8f67-c4a8fe2ad685/rules",
      • "policy_assignments": "/api/authorisation_policies/30a00ca1-861c-4c48-8f67-c4a8fe2ad685/assignments"
      }
    }

Update authorisation policy and its rules

Update an authorisation policy and its authorisation rules. If no authorisation rules are provided, all associated rules will be removed from the policy.

path Parameters
authorisation_policy_id
required
string
Example: e292c52d-74d1-4830-bf6e-58ef6c302db5

authorisation policy id

Request Body schema: application/vnd.api+json
required
object

Responses

https://{defaultHost}/api/authorisation_policies/{authorisation_policy_id}

Request samples

  • Payload
Content type
application/vnd.api+json
Example
{
  • "data": {
    • "attributes": {
      • "name": "delpha",
      • "description": "Ut blanditiis asperiores dolorem.",
      • "authorisation_rules": [
        • {
          • "path": "/projects/opc/assets/prj_soa",
          • "readable": false,
          • "updatable": false,
          • "executable": false
          },
        • {
          • "path": "/projects/opc/environments/dev",
          • "readable": false,
          • "updatable": false,
          • "executable": false
          }
        ]
      }
    }
}

Response samples

  • 200
  • 400
  • 404
Content type
application/vnd.api+json
{
  • "data": {
    • "id": "7aa92a29-f33a-448a-bde7-618eff998202",
    • "type": "authorisation_policy",
    • "attributes": {
      • "name": "Updated policy name",
      • "description": "Access for all incoming users",
      • "system": false,
      • "created_by": "verline_schneider",
      • "created_at": "2025-09-11T00:45:24.390780Z",
      • "updated_at": "2025-09-11T00:45:24.433265Z"
      },
    • "relationships": {
      • "policy_rules": {
        • "data": [ ]
        },
      • "policy_assignments": {
        • "data": [
          • {
            • "id": "7443ee94-608e-4af1-9fc4-b3a90b3e2ce1",
            • "type": "policy_assignment"
            }
          ]
        },
      • "authorisation_rules": {
        • "data": [ ]
        }
      },
    • "links": {
      • "self": "/api/authorisation_policies/7aa92a29-f33a-448a-bde7-618eff998202",
      • "policy_rules": "/api/authorisation_policies/7aa92a29-f33a-448a-bde7-618eff998202/rules",
      • "policy_assignments": "/api/authorisation_policies/7aa92a29-f33a-448a-bde7-618eff998202/assignments"

path Parameters
authorisation_policy_id
required
string
Example: e292c52d-74d1-4830-bf6e-58ef6c302db5

authorisation policy id

policy_rule_id
required
string
Example: 0d23a4e5-ac61-4e06-8d44-4ec9d1553f7f

policy rule id

Responses

https://{defaultHost}/api/authorisation_policies/{authorisation_policy_id}/rules/{policy_rule_id}

  • 204
  • 404
Content type
application/vnd.api+json
{ }

Users

Endpoints to interact with the users in the system.

List users

Lists users in the system

Responses

https://{defaultHost}/api/users

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
application/vnd.api+json
{
  • "data": [
    • {
      • "id": "7ff48f72-0fd7-425f-8001-9165d1d6674a",
      • "type": "user",
      • "attributes": {
        • "username": "clarisa",
        • "groupnames": [
          • "ldap-group-1",
          • "ldap-group-2"
          ],
        • "auth_provider": "ldap",
        • "created_at": "2025-09-11T00:46:19.289972Z",
        • "updated_at": "2025-09-11T00:46:19.289972Z"
        }
      }
    ]
}

Groups

Endpoints to interact with the user LDAP groups.

Secrets

Endpoints to interact with looking up secrets from the vault or decrypting AES encrypted strings. When sending an AES encrypted string in the query params, please ensure that the string is URL encoded (e.g. replacing + with %2B). This endpoint applies to any node path hierarchy. The below requests are valid:

  • /api/projects/demo/secrets?secret_path={secret_path}
  • /api/projects/demo/environments/dev/secrets?secret_path={secret_path})

Lookup a secret

Returns the decrypted value of the supplied secret path or AES encrypted string

path Parameters
project_code
required
string
Example: opc

project code

environment_code
required
string
Example: dev

environment code

secret_path
required
string
Example: secret-vault://path/to/vault/vault_key

secret path

Responses

https://{defaultHost}/api/projects/{project_code}/environments/{environment_code}/secrets?secret_path={secret_path}

Response samples

  • 200
  • 404
Content type
application/vnd.api+json
{
  • "data": {
    • "id": "secret-vault://path/to/vault/vault_key",
    • "type": "secret",
    • "attributes": {
      • "decrypted_value": "decrypted value"
      }
    }
}

Info

Get version and other information about the running OpsChain instance.

Get OpsChain server info

Responses

https://{defaultHost}/api/info

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
application/vnd.api+json
{
  • "data": {
    • "id": "0",
    • "type": "info",
    • "attributes": {
      • "version": "edge",
      • "runner_image": "limepoint/opschain-runner-enterprise:edge",
      • "db_version": "17.2",
      • "api_version": "7.1.5.1",
      • "ldap_available?": true,
      • "banners": [ ],
      • "instance_info": { }
      },
    • "links": {
      • "self": "/api/info"
      }
    }
}

System configuration

Endpoint to fetch the current system configuration.

Get OpsChain system configuration

Shows the current system configuration node.

query Parameters
include
string
Example: include=settings

Include the settings in the response

Responses

https://{defaultHost}/api/system_configuration

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
application/vnd.api+json
{
  • "data": {
    • "id": "e30debc0-c782-4269-abb3-c9b838290294",
    • "type": "system_configuration",
    • "attributes": {
      • "code": "system",
      • "name": "System Configuration",
      • "description": "System configuration node"
      },
    • "relationships": {
      • "settings": {
        • "data": {
          • "id": "1707e771-d8f5-480f-8bf3-6f1503287f88",
          • "type": "settings"
          },
        • "links": {
          • "related": "/api/settings/1707e771-d8f5-480f-8bf3-6f1503287f88"
          }
        }
      },
    • "links": {
      • "self": "/api/system_configuration",
      • "settings": "/api/settings/1707e771-d8f5-480f-8bf3-6f1503287f88"
      },
    • "meta": {
      • "can_have_changes": false,
      • "can_have_children": false,
      • "can_have_properties": false,
      • "can_have_settings": true,
      • "can_have_templates": false,
      • "requires_template": false,
      • "child_node_types": [ ],
      • "can_have_workflows": false,

        • "settings": {
          • "read": true,

          • "update": true
          }
        }

Admin operations

Endpoints to monitor the status of your OpsChain instance.

Get status information about the OpsChain database

Returns status information about the OpsChain database.

Responses

https://{defaultHost}/api/admin/database

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
application/vnd.api+json
{
  • "data": [
    • {
      • "id": "0",
      • "type": "database_status",
      • "attributes": {
        • "version": "17.2",
        • "uptime": 730,
        • "database_size": "10 MB",
        • "events_table_size": "40 kB",
        • "log_lines_table_size": "40 kB",
        • "connections": {
          • "active": 1,
          • "idle": 1,
          • "max_configured": 100
          },
        • "pod": {
          • "name": "opschain-db-pod",
          • "namespace": "opschain",
          • "node": "node1",
          • "host_ip": "192.168.1.1",
          • "pod_ip": "192.168.1.2",
          • "start_time": "2021-01-01",
          • "state": "Running",
          • "image": "opschain-db-image",
          • "restart_count": 0,
          • "pvc_name": "opschain-db-claim"
          }
        },
      • "links": {
        • "self": "/api/admin/database"
        }
      }
    ]
}

Content type
application/vnd.api+json
{
  • "data": [
    • {
      • "id": "opschain.limepoint.engineering",
      • "type": "node_status",
      • "attributes": {
        • "name": "opschain.limepoint.engineering",
        • "creation_timestamp": "2024-03-05T00:03:56Z",
        • "kubelet_version": "v1.29.6+k3s2",
        • "container_runtime_version": "docker://24.0.2",

          • "control-plane",

          • {
            • "type": "PIDPressure",

          • "ephemeral_storage": "103757316Ki"

          • "cpu": "16",
          • "memory": "131907404Ki",
          • "pods": "110",
          • "ephemeral_storage": "100935116926"
          },
        • "images": [
          • {
            • "names": [
              • "registry.local.gd:3443/opschain/runner@sha256:256",
              • "registry.local.gd:3443/opschain/runner:01234-id"
              ],
            • "size_bytes": 2615498231
            }
          ]
        }
      }
    ]
}

Get the status of the OpsChain queues

Responses

https://{defaultHost}/api/admin/queues

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
application/vnd.api+json
{
  • "data": [
    • {
      • "id": "default",
      • "type": "queue_status",
      • "attributes": {
        • "name": "default",
        • "summary": {
          • "total": 10,
          • "running": 2,
          • "failed": 1,
          • "scheduled": 3,
          • "finished": 4,
          • "pending": 1
          },
        • "jobs": [
          • {
            • "job_class": "ChangeJob",
            • "total": 5,
            • "running": 1,
            • "failed": 1,
            • "scheduled": 2,
            • "finished": 3,
            • "pending": 0,
            • "next_run_at": "2025-09-11T11:45:22.076+10:00",
            • "last_run_at": "2025-09-11T09:45:22.076+10:00",
            • "highest_error_count": 2,
            • "description": "Verifies if a change can be started based on its owner configuration and, if so, starts it."
            },
          • {
            • "job_class": "DataCleanupJob",
            • "total": 5,
            • "running": 0,
            • "failed": 0,
            • "scheduled": 0,
            • "finished": 0,
            • "pending": 0,
            • "next_run_at": "2025-09-11T11:45:22.076+10:00",
            • "last_run_at": "2025-09-11T08:45:22.076+10:00",
            • "highest_error_count": 0,
            • "description": "Cleans up data based on a data cleanup definition."
            }
          ]
        }
      }
    ]
}

Data cleanup definitions

Endpoints to interact with data cleanup definitions.

List data cleanup definitions

Lists all data cleanup definitions.

query Parameters
filter[<query/sort filter>]=
string
Example: filter[<query/sort filter>]==> filter[name_eq]=test

API filtering guide

Responses

https://{defaultHost}/api/data_cleanup_definitions

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
application/vnd.api+json
{
  • "data": [
    • {
      • "id": "bb67a105-7b11-4701-bc53-e42009c17fd7",
      • "type": "data_cleanup_definition",
      • "attributes": {
        • "name": "matrix",
        • "enabled": true,
        • "created_by": "lorraine",
        • "cron_schedule": "0 0 7,14,21,28 * *",
        • "repeat": true,
        • "maximum_run_count": null,
        • "purge_activities": false,
        • "purge_events": true,
        • "purge_jobs": false,
        • "filters": {
          • "changes": {
            • "created_at_lt": "2025-09-04T00:45:39.930Z"
            }
          },
        • "node_paths": [
          • "/projects/opc/environments/dev"
          ],
        • "run_count": 0,
        • "created_at": "2025-09-11T00:45:39.933196Z",
        • "updated_at": "2025-09-11T00:45:39.933196Z",
        • "next_run_at": "2025-09-13T14:00:00.000000Z",
        • "run_at": null,
        • "end_at": null
        },
      • "links": {
        • "self": "/api/data_cleanup_definitions/bb67a105-7b11-4701-bc53-e42009c17fd7"
        }
      }
    ],
  • "meta": {
    • "authorisations": {
      • "update": true
      },
    • "has_any": true
    }
}

Create data cleanup definition

Notes:

  1. See the various payload examples to understand the required fields for each possible request to this endpoint.
  2. Either the cron_schedule or run_at fields must be provided.
  3. The keys accepted for the filters field are changes, events, jobs, and workflow_runs. Each of these can have ransack filters for the specific type they refer to. IMPORTANT: If no filters are provided for a data type, the cleanup will remove all data that matches the node paths.
  4. The node_paths field is an array of strings. Each string is a path to a node. The path must start with /projects and only contain forward slashes, lowercase letters, numbers and underscores, and optionally a single "%" at the end. Use the % wildcard to include all nodes under a specific node or node-type, note that this will apply the cleanup to all nodes that are yet to be created, as long as they match the path.
Request Body schema: application/vnd.api+json
required
object

Responses

https://{defaultHost}/api/data_cleanup_definitions

Request samples

  • Payload
Content type
application/vnd.api+json
Example
{
  • "data": {
    • "attributes": {
      • "name": "Will run once at 1am on 1st January 2020",
      • "enabled": true,
      • "node_paths": [ ],
      • "filters": { },
      • "purge_activities": false,
      • "purge_events": false,
      • "purge_jobs": true,
      • "cron_schedule": "12 15 21 9 6",
      • "run_at": "2020-01-01 01:00:00 UTC",
      • "end_at": null,
      • "maximum_run_count": null,
      • "repeat": false
      }
    }
}

Response samples

  • 201
  • 400
Content type
application/vnd.api+json
{
  • "data": {
    • "id": "a3749219-5936-4a29-a01b-a1ff53946711",
    • "type": "data_cleanup_definition",
    • "attributes": {
      • "name": "array",
      • "enabled": true,
      • "created_by": "rick",
      • "cron_schedule": "38 21 6 3 3",
      • "repeat": true,
      • "maximum_run_count": null,
      • "purge_activities": false,
      • "purge_events": true,
      • "purge_jobs": true,
      • "filters": { },
      • "node_paths": [ ],
      • "run_count": 0,
      • "created_at": "2025-09-11T00:45:40.165482Z",
      • "updated_at": "2025-09-11T00:45:40.165482Z",
      • "next_run_at": "2026-03-04T10:38:00.000000Z",
      • "run_at": null,
      • "end_at": null
      },
    • "links": {
      • "self": "/api/data_cleanup_definitions/a3749219-5936-4a29-a01b-a1ff53946711"
      }
    },
  • "meta": {
    • "authorisations": {
      • "update": true
      }
    }
}

Show a data cleanup definition

Shows a data cleanup definition.

path Parameters
data_cleanup_definition_id
required
string
Example: ccf5c310-20dd-46b4-b5a3-0cb5f6869bc8

data cleanup definition id

Responses

  • 200
  • 404
Content type
application/vnd.api+json
{
  • "data": {
    • "id": "cc7c6039-a563-44d2-a390-5800946c6f04",
    • "type": "data_cleanup_definition",
    • "attributes": {
      • "name": "array",
      • "enabled": true,
      • "created_by": "hershel.west",
      • "cron_schedule": "0 0 7,14,21,28 * *",
      • "repeat": true,
      • "maximum_run_count": null,
      • "purge_activities": true,
      • "purge_events": true,
      • "purge_jobs": true,
      • "filters": {
        • "changes": {
          • "created_at_lt": "2025-09-04T00:45:40.573Z"
          }
        },
      • "node_paths": [
        • "/projects/opc/environments/dev"
        ],
      • "run_count": 0,
      • "created_at": "2025-09-11T00:45:40.575777Z",
      • "updated_at": "2025-09-11T00:45:40.575777Z",
      • "next_run_at": "2025-09-13T14:00:00.000000Z",
      • "run_at": null,
      • "end_at": null
      },
    • "links": {
      • "self": "/api/data_cleanup_definitions/cc7c6039-a563-44d2-a390-5800946c6f04"
      }
    },
  • "meta": {
    • "authorisations": {
      • "update": true
      }
    }
}

Update the data cleanup definition

Updates a data cleanup definition.

Notes:

  1. See the various payload examples in the create endpoint to understand the attributes you can supply to this endpoint.
  2. The payload need only consist of the attributes you wish to modify. There is no need to supply the entire data cleanup definition.
path Parameters
data_cleanup_definition_id
required
string
Example: ccf5c310-20dd-46b4-b5a3-0cb5f6869bc8

data cleanup definition id

Request Body schema: application/vnd.api+json
required
object

Responses

https://{defaultHost}/api/data_cleanup_definitions/{data_cleanup_definition_id}

Request samples

  • Payload
Content type
application/vnd.api+json
Example
{
  • "data": {
    • "attributes": {
      • "name": "new_name",
      • "enabled": true,
      • "node_paths": [ ],
      • "filters": { },
      • "purge_activities": false,
      • "purge_events": false,
      • "purge_jobs": true,
      • "cron_schedule": "51 13 2 5 *",
      • "run_at": null,
      • "end_at": null,
      • "maximum_run_count": null,
      • "repeat": true
      }
    }
}

Response samples

  • 200
  • 400
  • 404
Content type
application/vnd.api+json
{
  • "data": {
    • "id": "2d69e8a5-b416-4833-927f-e48b74f2f98c",
    • "type": "data_cleanup_definition",
    • "attributes": {
      • "name": "new_name",
      • "enabled": true,
      • "created_by": "neoma",
      • "cron_schedule": "0 0 7,14,21,28 * *",
      • "repeat": true,
      • "maximum_run_count": 5,
      • "purge_activities": true,
      • "purge_events": true,
      • "purge_jobs": true,
      • "filters": {
        • "changes": {
          • "created_at_lt": "2025-09-04T00:45:41.001Z"
          }
        },
      • "node_paths": [
        • "/projects/opc/environments/dev"
        ],
      • "run_count": 0,
      • "created_at": "2025-09-11T00:45:41.004025Z",
      • "updated_at": "2025-09-11T00:45:41.040874Z",

      }
    },
  • "meta": {
    • "authorisations": {
      • "update": true
      }
    }
}

Delete the data cleanup definition

path Parameters
data_cleanup_definition_id
required
string
Example: ccf5c310-20dd-46b4-b5a3-0cb5f6869bc8

data cleanup definition id

Responses

https://{defaultHost}/api/data_cleanup_definitions/{data_cleanup_definition_id}

Response samples

  • 204
  • 404
Content type
application/vnd.api+json
{ }
